title: WEB APP
name: NOTEBOOK WEB APP
description: Developed a multi-user notebook application where users can create, update and delete personal notes.

Implemented user authentication with a 'Remember Me' feature, allowing dynamic session handling via sessionStorage or localStorage and providing each user with a personalized and secure space to manage their notes
Ensured password security using bcrypt for hashing and validation.
Designed a responsive front-end UI and clean routing for user-specific dashboards.
techstack: React JS, Node Js, MongoDB, Express Js, JWT Token

title: WEB GAME
name: SNAKE GAME
description: Developed an interactive Snake game using HTML5 Canvas, CSS, and JavaScript.
Implemented a dynamic scoring system that updates in real-time as the snake consumes food.
Enhanced gameplay by increasing snake speed and enlarging food size upon reaching score thresholds.
Created a responsive canvas area defining the snakeâ€™s movement boundaries and smooth animations.
Strengthened JavaScript proficiency through hands-on experience in DOM manipulation, game loops, and canvas rendering.

title: ANALYTICS
name: HEALTHCARE ANALYTICS DASHBOARD
description: Designed and planned a data dashboard using Azure Databricks and other Azure services, aimed at providing accessible insights for healthcare administration and government agencies.
Conducted a comprehensive analysis of patient data across three hospitals, comprising of total of 150 sample records.
Leveraged statistical models to identify critical health risk factors,enabling informed healthcare decision making.
Planneed to identify and determine the resources required, enabling the optimized allocation of healthcare resources across departments for improved efficiency and patient care outcomes.
techstack: Azure Databricks, PySpark, Azure Blob Storage

title: CHATBOT
name: MEDHA - AN AI-POWERED CHATBOT FOR COLLEGE WEBSITE
description: Developed an chatbot for a college website using the DistilBERT transformer model, a lightweight encoder-based architecture optimized for performance.
Trained the model on a custom dataset of 550+ labeled queries, covering diverse college-related intents such as College Information, Faculty Details, Clubs, and more.
Achieved 83.19% accuracy and an F1-score of 81.36%, demonstrating strong intent classification performance.
Enhanced user experience by enabling real-time, context-aware responses for commonly asked queries on the college website.
techstack: DistilBERT Model, Websockets, Hugging Face, Python 3.12, HTML5, CSS, Javascript
